metadata.title: CVE-2016-2184 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The create_fixed_stream_quirk function in sound/usb/quirks.c in thesnd-usb-audio driver in the Linux kernel before 4.5.1 allows physicallyproximate attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereferenceor double free, and system crash) via a crafted endpoints value in a USBdevice descriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-86-generic - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-86-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-86-lowlatency - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-3.13.0-86-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-86.130

linux-image-3.13.0-86-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-86.130

linux-image-3.13.0-86-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-86.130
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-86-generic - 3.13.0-86.130
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-86.130').
